hints.content:
To compare fractions, both wholes must be the same size.

Which image shows $\dfrac{2}{3}$ and $\dfrac{2}{6}$ represented on the same size whole?

This image shows $\dfrac{2}{3}$ and $\dfrac{2}{6}$ on the same size wholes. Now it is fair to compare them!

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the triangles. The first rectangle is divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded. The second rectangle is divided into 6 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first rectangle covers more space than the shaded area of the second rectangle. !

hints.content:
This image best allows us to compare the fractions.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the triangles. The first rectangle is divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded. The second rectangle is divided into 6 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first rectangle covers more space than the shaded area of the second rectangle. !

question.content:
**Which picture best helps us compare $\dfrac{2}{3}$ and $\dfrac{2}{6}$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: The triangle is smaller than the quadrilateral, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![A triangle and a quadrilateral. There is an equal sign between the shapes. The triangle is is divided into 3 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded. The quadrilateral is twice the size of the triangle. It is divided into 6 equal parts of the same size as in the triangle. 2 part are shaded. The total shaded area of triangle covers the same amount of space as the shaded area of the quadrilateral.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0689505430f7f466b8738c0f71218c67bf73637)

choices.clue: The first hexagon is smaller than the second hexagon, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two hexagons of different sizes. There is a less than sign between the hexagons. The first hexagon is divided into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The second hexagon is bigger than the first hexagon. It is divided into 6 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded. The total shaded area of the first hexagon covers less space than the shaded area of the second hexagon.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0100ce87cc03a354456180b3a62f42856d980b13)

choices.clue: The rectangles are the same size, so it is fair to compare the area of the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two rectangles of the same size. There is a greater than sign between the triangles. The first rectangle is divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded. The second rectangle is divided into 6 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first rectangle covers more space than the shaded area of the second rectangle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8c011231b38651be0c5a247c6cebe22e14f3d814)
